title: Market Disequilibrium in the market for wheat

content.question:

 <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn></math>
 <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mn>500</mn></math>

The table provided shows the market demand and supply schedules for wheat. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: At a price of <math alttext="$1" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>1</mn></math>, there is excess supply of wheat and the price will decrease.
At a price of <math alttext="$2" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>2</mn></math>, there is excess demand for wheat and the price will decrease.
At a price of <math alttext="$3" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>3</mn></math>, there is excess demand for wheat and the price will increase.
At a price of <math alttext="$4" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>4</mn></math>, there is excess supply of wheat and the price will decrease.
At a price of <math alttext="$5" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>5</mn></math>, there is excess demand for wheat and the price will increase.

content.answer: At a price of <math alttext="$4" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>4</mn></math>, there is excess supply of wheat and the price will decrease.

topic.text: 2.7: Market Disequilibrium and Changes in Equilibrium

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
